title: About
text:
Hi, My Name is Akhil Bellamkonda. My Github account is https://github.com/akhilbelllamkonda and my account is akhilbelllamkonda@gmail.com
Github link: https://github.com/akhilbelllamkonda/Air-Quality-Final-Project
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp. -https://bootcamp.davidkane.info/.

title: Air Quality in India(2015-2020)
text:
The Air Quality in India is changing rapidly due to rise in population in those areas. This data was sourced from a data set which was created by Kaggle. Then, different pollutants were joined to analyze the relationship between city and pollution. The example shows us that there is more air pollution in the areas with higher population.









This script maps average PM2.5 levels across major Indian cities using Kaggle’s “Air Quality Data in India (2015-2020)”. It helps visualize spatial differences in particulate matter levels, aiding in environmental management insights.

title: Air Quality Final PRoject

title: Sources
text: For my project, I used a data source from Kaggle named ‘Air Quality in India(2015-2020). The link is Air Quality Data in India (2015 - 2020) (kaggle.com). The first thing I did to this data is remove all the missing values using drop_na(). Then I removed duplicate values. Then I used summarize to use the ’avg_pm2.5’ variable.
